name: Black Vulture
description: The Black Vulture is a large scavenger with dark feathers, known for its aggressive feeding.
spread_note: Found in southern Europe and Central Asia.
food_note: Dominates feeding sites, often displacing other scavengers.
proportions: Wingspan: 2.5-3 m, length: 100-110 cm, weight: 7-14 kg.
reproduction: Lays 1 egg in a nest in trees or cliffs, incubation about 55 days.
attractions: Notable in zoos for their commanding presence.
projects_note: Vulnerable due to poisoning and habitat loss; conservation is active.
